title: Executive Order 5021-Making Edward V. Sheely Eligible for Nomination Without Examination
content: The Executive Order of June 22, 1928, amending previous executive orders requiring candidates for presidential postmasterships to pass a civil service examination, is hereby waived so as to permit the nomination of Dr. Edward V. Sheely as postmaster at Memphis, Tennessee, without examination.
citation: Calvin Coolidge, Executive Order 5021-Making Edward V. Sheely Eligible for Nomination Without Examination Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360744
